# Sarah Furman Warner Williams

Sarah Furman Warner Williams (1764â€“1848) was an American embroiderer and quiltmaker. Her coverlet, which she made in 1803 to honor the marriage of her 17-year old cousin Phebe Berrien Warner to Henry Cotheal, is included in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Needlework pieces by Williams are in the collection of the Winterthur Museum, Garden and Library.
